paper_title.ja: 伊勢湾伊良湖水道の海洋構造の観測．
伊勢湾伊良湖水道沖の海洋構造の観測
paper_title.en: Observation on the Oceanic Structures off Irago Strait of Ise Bay

description.ja: 伊勢湾とその沖の外洋との相互作用を調べるため,三重大学の練習船『勢水丸』を用いて志摩半島沖から浜名湖沖を結ぶ直線の観測線で1995年5月から1998年8月までの四季にわたり計11回のCTDとADCPによる観測を行った.1995年5月の観測では紀伊半島の南沖から黒潮系の暖水の接近がみられ,1995年と1996年の10月には御前崎から伊勢湾沖を西進する黒潮のストリーマーが観測された.特に1995年10月には流速が1.5m sec^<-1>を超える強いストリーマーの一部が50cm sec^<-1>以上の流速で伊勢湾に流入していることが観測された.また,春は志摩半島沖と浜名湖沖から低塩分の湾内水が外洋へ流出する現象が観測されたが,夏には観測線の全域で34psu以下の低塩分水が10m程度の厚さを持って流出することが観測された.1997年1月,1998年4月の観測では共に観測線の中央部の約40m以深に密度が極大となる領域があり,熱塩フロントとの関連が示唆された.冬季のADCPによる観測では10mから40m深まで鉛直にほぼ一様な流れが観測され,内部圧力傾度が無いことと合わせて流れに地衡流平衡が成立している可能性が示唆された.
description.en: In order to investigate the interaction between Ise Bay and its offshore region, eleven observations of temperature, salinity and velocity along the observational line from Shima Peninsula to Lake Hamana were carried out during May 1995 and August 1998 by use of Training Vessel "Seisui-maru" of Mie University. An approach of warm Kuroshio water to the observational line along the eastern coast of Kii Peninsula was observed in May 1995. A warm streamer of Kuroshio water from off Omae-zaki with a large velocity more than 1.5m sec^<-1> was observed in October 1995, and a part of streamer intruded into Ise Bay with a velocity more than 50cm sec^<-1>. Less saline bay water flew out from off Shima Peninsula and from off Lake Hamana in spring, while in summer, a surface bay water with a salinity less than 34psu flew out from all over the observational line in the form of a layer shallower than 10m. In January 1997 and April 1998, density maximum regions were observed below the depth of 40m in the central region of the observational line, which suggests that this density maximum regions are associated with the formation of a thermohaline front. According to ADCP measurement in winter, a vertically homogeneous field of velocity was observed from the depths from 10m to 40m along the observational line. Because of vertically homogeneous velocity and density fields without internal pressure gradient, it is suggested that the geostrophic flow balance is established in offshore area of Ise Bay.

Oceanic structure in the vcinity of Komahashi Daini Kaigan,a Seamount in the Kyoushu-Parau Ridge. PartⅠ temperature Saliruly Field
A numerical study on the coastal topographic effect of a peninsula on the western boundary current

description.en: Coastal topographic effects of a peninsula on the western boundary current are studied numerically with reference to the difference in northern boundary inclination (NBI) from a zonal direction. It is shown from the numerical experiments that the two dominant path patterns of the western boundary current exist: one flow pattern is a large meander path with spinup and spindown of the cyclonic eddy and the other is a nonlarge (straight) path along the northern boundary. if a peninsula is located upstream (west) of the separation point of the mean flow flowing out from the northernmost area of the western boundary region, a large meander path with spinup and spindown of the cyclonic eddy is changed to an irregular oscillation by the topographic effect of the peninsula in the case of no NBI. A nonlarge meander path with a small cyclonic eddy just downstream of the peninsula is formed in the cases with NBI larger than 10 degrees. Formation of the large meander path and the nonlarge meander path agrees with models without a peninsula and the topographic effect of the peninsula located upstream of the separation point of the mean flow is shown to be relatively small. If a peninsula is located downstream (east) of the separation point of the mean flow, a large meander path has a tendency to appear in the case with a relatively large NBI of more than 20 degrees by the topographic effect of the peninsula, which is different from the previous two cases without a peninsula and with a peninsula located upstream of the separation point of the mean flow. If NBI exceeds 30 degrees, only large meander path is commonly formed in all the cases, and the topographic effect of the peninsula is weak. It is found that both topographic effects of NBI and the peninsula located downstream of the separation of the mean flow are important for path dynamics of a western boundary current.

paper_title.ja: 尾鷲湾における海況変動の観測
paper_title.en: Observation on the oceanic condition of Owase Bay

description.ja: 1994年8月と1996年2月初旬から3月初旬までのそれぞれ約1ヵ月間,尾鷲湾の4点で計7層の水温と流速の観測を行った.その観測の主な結果をまとめた.湾奥の観測点の1m深の水温は冬季に他の観測点と比較して極めて温度が高く,火力発電所による温排水の影響を受けていることが示された.夏季の観測では全観測点の10m以浅で8月12日から15日にかけて黒潮から切離した暖水ストリーマーによる高水温が観測され,その影響が尾鷲湾の湾奥まで達することが示された.佐波留(さばる)島の北に設置した観測点ではほぼ水深急変部の等深線に沿う北西と南東方向の流れが卓越し,地形にトラップされた流れの存在が示された.外洋に面した観測点3と4の10m深の流速は互いにコヒーレントな変動をしており,黒潮系の暖水の接近などに関連する流速変動の卓越が示唆された.さらに,外洋に面した海域では冬季の混合層に伴って鉛直にコヒーレントな流速構造が観測され,夏季に比べて流速が顕著に小さいことから,流れは地衡流バランスした性質を持つことが推量された.2月10日より17日まで紀伊半島東部を北上する黒潮の暖水舌が生じ,尾鷲湾の沖側に面した2つの観測点の10m深で30cm sec^<-1>を越える冬季としては顕著な北上流が観測された.冬季は黒潮の接近による水温の影響は少ないものの,流速場には大きな影響が生じることが示された.
description.en: Observations on temperature and velocity at four points with seven observational levels in Owase Bay during 30 days were carried out in August 1994 and from early February to early May in 1996. Main results of these observations are mentioned in the present paper. At 1 meter depth of the observational station located at innermost of Owase Bay, temperature exceeds 15℃ in February, which is significantly warmer than that observed at other stations, from which the large influences by the thermal water discharged from the thermal electric power plant is suggested in winter. A homogeneous warm water is observed on 12-15 August 1994 at all observational stations shallower than 10m, which is due to the approach of a warm streamer separated from main axis of the Kuroshio. It is shown that the intrusion of the Kuroshio water up to innermost part of Owase Bay has a large influence on the oceanic condition of the Bay. At an observational station located at the northeast of the Sabaru-Jima (Sabaru Island), which is located at a central region of Owase Bay, a velocity along the isopleth of the depth on a steep slope from northwest to southeast is dominant and its tendency in deeper layer (40m deep) is more significant than that in shallower layer (10m deep), which indicates that the velocity fields have a tendency of bottom trapped mode. At two stations located at offshore region in Owase Bay, observed velocities have coherent variations each other and the velocity associated with the approach of warm Kuroshio water dominates. Furthermore, because vertically coherent flow is observed in winter by the formation of the mixed layer and because velocity is significantly weak in winter in comparison with that in summer, a velocity in the offshore region of Owase Bay is suggested to show a geostrophic flow balance. During 10-17 February 1996, a relatively large northward velocity in winter more than 30cm sec^<-1> is observed at stations 3 and 4 located at offshore region in Owase Bay, which is caused by northward warm water tongue from the Kuroshio. In winter, velocity fields response to the approach of warm Kuroshio water in Owase bay is relatively more sensitive in comparison with that of temperature fields.

publisher.ja: 日本海洋学会沿岸海洋研究部会

paper_title.en: Warm water structure that approaches to Kii Peninsla, separated from the straight zonal Kuroshio pale
Topographic effect of Izu Ridge on the distribution of the North Pacific Intermediate Water south of Japan

description.en: The topographic effect of the Izu Ridge on the horizontal distribution of the North Pacific Intermediate Water (NPIW) south of Japan has been studied using observational data obtained by the Seisui-Maru of Mie University (Mie Univ. data) and those compiled by Japan Oceanographic Data Center (JODC data). Both data sets show that water of salinity less than 34.1 psu on potential density (σ(θ)) surface of 26.8 is confined to the eastern side of the Izu Ridge, while water of salinity less than 34.2 psu is confined to the southern area over the Izu Ridge at a depth greater than 2000 m and to the southeastern area in the Shikoku Basin. It is also shown by T-S analysis of Mie Univ. data over the Izu Ridge that water of salinity less than 34.2 psu dominates south of 30°N, where the depth of the Izu Ridge is deeper than 2000 m and the NPIW can intrude westward over the Izu Ridge. JODC data reveal that relatively large standard deviations of the salinity on σ(θ) surface of 26.7, 26.8 and 26.9 are detected along the mean current path of the Kuroshio and the Kuroshio Extension. Almost all of the standard deviations are less than 0.05 psu in other area with the NPIW, which shows that the time variation in the salinity can be neglected. This observational evidence shows that the topographic effect of the Izu Ridge on the horizontal distribution of the NPIW, which is formed east of 145°E by the mixing of the Kuroshio water and the Oyashio water, is prominent north of 30°N with a depth shallower than 2000 m.

paper_title.en: On variations in the subarctic circulation in the North Pacific

description.en: Anomalous southward shifts in the Oyashio and subarctic circulation in the North Pacific occur from winter to late spring, and the wide extension of cold sea surface temperatures (SST) influences the atmospheric circulation over the North Pacific. This anomalous southward shift results from the barotropic response of the ocean to changes in the wind stress induced by the southward shift of the deepening Aleutian Low. Global changes in the ocean and atmosphere associated with these anomalous shift of the Oyashio and subarctic circulation in the North Pacific are examined in this study. It is shown that both the area of sea ice in the Okhotsk Sea and the extent of snow cover over the Eurasian Continent decrease in winter in association with this anomalous shift. The teleconnection between equatorial SST and the southward shift of the enhanced Aleutian Low was weak after 1989 as a result of a decadal climatic change. Even so, the relationship between reductions in the areas of sea ice in the Okhotsk Sea and snow cover over the Eurasian Continent in the winter and the anomalous southward shift of the Oyashio and the subarctic circulation persisted through the decadal change.
